samples.question: Have you ever borrowed books from other people?
samples.transcript: >> Yes, I have. but many just it was in the past, you know, when I was like a primary school student. we would go to the library, the school libraries to borrow some books from librarians in the school and we would read those translated version of those great literatures. I remember we got some books from the Russian Russian literatures and also English ones. Yeah. But they were all in Chinese.
samples.transcript_original: >> Yes, I have. Uh but many just uh it was in the past, you know, when I was like a primary school student. uh we would go to the library, the school libraries to borrow some books from um librarians in the school and we would read those um uh translated version um of those great literatures. I remember we got some books from the Russian um Russian literatures and also English ones. Yeah. But they were all in Chinese.
samples.transcript_cleaned: >> Yes, I have. but many just it was in the past, you know, when I was like a primary school student. we would go to the library, the school libraries to borrow some books from librarians in the school and we would read those translated version of those great literatures. I remember we got some books from the Russian Russian literatures and also English ones. Yeah. But they were all in Chinese.

samples.question: >> And has anyone ever borrowed money from you?
samples.transcript: >> Yes. It does not really happen that often, but I did actually borrow some money back when I was I think when we were like in in college where we are kind of like broke and sometimes, you know, a friend of mine would borrow some money to buy something and I would just, you know, lend them some.
samples.transcript_original: >> Yes. It uh doesn't really happen that often, but I did actually borrow some money um back when I was I think when we were like in in college where we're kind of like broke and sometimes, you know, a friend of mine would borrow some money to buy something and I would just, you know, lend them some.

samples.question: >> Do you like to lend things to other people?
samples.transcript: >> Well, it really depends on what kind of thing we are talking about here. If it is something that is too personal, for example, a foam, I would not I would not necessarily want to do that.

samples.question: >> And how do you feel when people do not return things that they have borrowed from you?
samples.transcript: >> Well, definitely I would feel annoyed. I think it is not nice. and then I I do not like confrontation, so I would just subtly kind of like hinting them that they need to return something they borrow from me. yeah, I would not like say it like directly like, "Hey, you know, you need to return something or no, I would not do that." >>.
samples.transcript_original: >> Well, definitely I would feel annoyed. I think it's not nice. Um, yeah, I wouldn't like say it like directly like, "Hey, you know, uh, you need to return something or no, I wouldn't do that." >>.

samples.question: Did you like listening to stories when you were a child?
samples.transcript: >> Yes, I did. back when I was a little kid. my parents were pretty busy, but I had an older sister who would you know, read some bedtime stories to me. You know, those Chinese folk stories that she would read to me and yeah, I love it.
samples.transcript_original: >> Yes, I did. Uh, back when I was a little kid. Um, my parents were pretty busy, but I had an older sister who would uh, you know, uh, read some bedtime stories to me. You know, those Chinese folk stories that she would read to me and um, yeah, I love it.
samples.transcript_cleaned: >> Yes, I did. back when I was a little kid. my parents were pretty busy, but I had an older sister who would you know, read some bedtime stories to me. You know, those Chinese folk stories that she would read to me and yeah, I love it.

samples.question: >> And nowadays, do you prefer listening to stories or reading them?
samples.transcript: >> Good question. I love listening to audiobooks. I feel like it is it I do not know. I feel like it requires a lot if you have to sit down and read a book yourself, but while you are listening to audiobooks, you get to do some other things. You can multitask like cleaning your room and stuff. I just feel like I I I cannot really sit down for a while and just read. It would be a little bit boring for me.
samples.transcript_original: >> Good question. I love listening to audiobooks. Um, I feel like it's it I don't know. samples.question: And do you think you will go to Spain in the future?
samples.transcript: >> Yes, I am actually considering doing a SELTA certificate there. Yeah. >> Okay. So.
samples.transcript_original: >> Yes, I'm actually considering doing a SELTA certificate there. Yeah. >> Okay. So,.
samples.transcript_cleaned: >> Yes, I am actually considering doing a SELTA certificate there. Yeah. >>

samples.question: What do you think about that?
samples.transcript: >> I think it is certainly true. You know, there there are quite a lot of old senior citizens would prefer to travel to an area where they feel familiar with. I think on one hand it is it is it is sort of like give them a feeling of being nostalgic, you know. I I think it is a feeling that everybody sort of wanted to experience from time to time. So I would not think that just old people's thing. I think everybody wants to go somewhere that they feel most familiar with. but I I I do think that there are some other old people like to try new things. you have heard people maybe travel to a new country without really knowing about the language. that is not just young people's privilege. I think nowadays older people are still kind of like trying to think outside of the box and you know trying trying to do something new. Yeah. >> You know one thing I see regularly for example part of the year I spend time in Barcelona and I see large tour buses full of lots and lots of old people traveling together.

samples.question: What do you think are the pros and cons of traveling in a large group?
samples.transcript: Okay, the pros are I hate using the word, but it is it is sort of like efficient. If you want to stay being traveling, if you want to, you know, want to experience all of those tourist destinations in one day or in a very tight schedule, that would definitely help you to fulfill that that that that goals that you have. I have not I have nothing against that. But but for me or for some people like me or a lot of people I think they would prefer something that is more individual. They would not want to cause them a tourist. They want to call them a traveler. So by doing that they sort of cut themselves off you know with the the chance of talking to local people or going to those hidden gems or like offbeaten path like I mentioned and they would lost a lot tremendously a lot I mean if they just you know hop on a tourist bus and going to those tourist destinations it is a little it is a shame. Yeah.

samples.question: How do you think tourism traveling will change in the future?
samples.transcript: >> I think it will probably become more and more personal tailored. where people might hire a personal guy. Now it is still it is kind of like picking it up, but I think it will become a new norm where people would hire a a personal guy who live in a local and actually showing them around you know the the the restaurant that no local people go or even have the so-called eco tourism or the nowadays they even invite them to local community to contribute you know thinking about a person who is from China going to Spain and stay in local community maybe have like a you Chinese or language exchange meetup and things like that. That would be cool. I think it is still picking up. I think in the future it will become a new norm especially for Chinese people. I think a lot of Chinese people are still trying to you know when they go traveling they still sort of like going to the tourist destinations but I think I I' I have seen people are doing a little bit of change of that and you know having an individual trip or or even just like I said traveling abroad and experience a different culture and stuff. >>.

samples.question: What do you think are the advantages for a country of hosting such a large sporting event?
samples.transcript: The advantage is is definitely by you know hosting those events you get to show people you know how you know the it is it is it is a way of showing your strength as a nation you know and and then show people you know the great infrastructure that you have or how how you know united the a country is you know towards a certain goal and and in a solidified a country's ambition. but I would argue that it if we if we always using this kind of way to sort of show off there is a fine nine I mean on one hand the great instructure infrastructure that you have can definitely show the the strength the econ economic growth that you have but on the other hand we should also consider about the environmental issue and also a lot of whole saloo of issues that related to that. it is just one part of showing that how great the country is. >> Okay. Thank you very much. That is the end of the speaking test. >> Thank you, >> Zane. Wonderful speaking test.

samples.question: So, what about these people?
samples.transcript: >> We all got we all need to start from somewhere. You know, when I first started, when I was in high school, I grew up in a rural area in China. I was not exposed to, you know, the the the authentic English materials. But but then I started to watch those TV shows like the, you know, the classic sitcom like Friends, you know. So I would suggest people who really want to you know who who are who have a lower level of English proficiency they can start to watch they can start watch something that is maybe easier to understand cartoons animations it is always a good start you know I am a big fan of Pixar I think they can start they can always find the English materials that is you know suit their level so it should not be too difficult and it should not be too easy So they can just adjust what they like to listen to listen to or watch. I would suggest animations stay away from the Big Ben theory no matter what people say because that those are really difficult and also the two girls and they they keep saying like that is the greatest thing but for me I think it is a good TV show the shows I just list but it might not be really good for you. You know you should watch something that is more regarding daily lives. I I mean there is a one show called Brothers and Sisters. I really love that show. it is really good. yeah. you can start watching those like I said you know more life related kind of TV series instead of those hot TV shows might not really suit you. Yeah. >> So you know one question that I get is >> from a lot of students is like there is no native speakers around. there is no one for me to practice with who is a native speaker. And and your advice is well actually you do not need a native speaker. there is a whole world of content at your fingertips.

samples.question: [Transcript chunk 3]
samples.transcript: Adults a lot of skills that young adults need to learn so for example how to survive in this world because let us just say that survive in this real world is dangerous because you cannot know whether you walked off the streets somebody's going to hurt you somebody's going to do something to you so I think number one is how to learn how to survive in the real world world and number two is that you have to be confident and be yourself in this world because I think that like I said in the section two be yourself and stepped up the norm is really important because as for me that is how you show yourself and like you know freedom of expression thank you very much foreign.
